responses.content:
```yaml leads: - headline: Potential Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) via User Input analysis: | The codebase appears to use user-supplied data directly within HTML templates without proper sanitization. This might allow an attacker to inject malicious JavaScript code or other template directives that get executed on the server-side. For example, if user input is directly embedded within a template like so: ```html

{{.Title}}

``` an attacker might be able to supply a malicious payload as the "Title" parameter, potentially leading to SSTI. cwe: CWE-94 function_names: [] filenames: - html/views/simple.html - html/views/index.html - html/views/errors/404.html classification: slightly promising - headline: Possible Authorization Bypass via Template Logic analysis: | The use of `{{if isAdmin .User}}` within templates suggests a role-based access control system. However, it's unclear how "isAdmin" is determined and whether this check is consistently enforced across all relevant templates and routes. If the `isAdmin` flag or logic is not correctly implemented or enforced, an attacker might be able to bypass authorization checks and access restricted content or functionalities, as seen in the `admin.html` and `extended.html` templates. cwe: CWE-863 function_names: [] filenames: - html/views/admin.html - html/views/extended.html classification: not promising ```
